101:1.tafsir: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said regarding the interpretation of Allah's saying (Calamity! What is the Calamity?): '(Calamity!

101:10.tafsir: (Ah, what will convey unto thee) O Muhammad (what she is!) this is to show how tremendous she is,

101:2.tafsir: What is the Calamity?) He says: the Hour! What is the Hour? He said this to arouse his wonder; the Hour is called Calamity because it shakes people's hearts.

101:3.tafsir: (Ah, what will convey unto thee) O Muhammad (what the Calamity is!) he said this to show its tremendousness.

101:4.tafsir: Allah then gave more details about it, saying: (A day wherein mankind will be) a day when people will fall on each other (as thickly scattered moths

101:5.tafsir: And the mountains will become as carded wool.

101:6.tafsir: Then, as for him whose scales are heavy (with good works)) as for him whose good works weigh heavy on his scale; this refers to the believer,

101:7.tafsir: (He will live a pleasant life) He will be in a pleasant Paradise, pleasing to himself.

101:8.tafsir: (But as for him whose scales are light) i.e. the disbeliever,

101:9.tafsir: (The Bereft and Hungry One will be his mother) his abode and destination will be the Fire; it is also said this means: he will be thrown in the Fire.
